title: Weekend Wodehouse
description: This title is presented with an introduction by Hilaire Belloc. 'P.G. Wodehouse remains the greatest chronicler of a certain kind of Englishness, that no one else has ever captured quite so sharply, or with quite as much wit and affection' - Julian Fellowes. "Weekend Wodehouse" - required reading at country house parties in the late Thirties - remains one of the best introductions to the work of PG Wodehouse. All the favourites are Drones Club stories, Mr Mullinger stories, and stories of Jeeves, Lord Amsworth and Ukridge.
author: P.G. Wodehouse
